titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia expeditions records 1930-1995
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia expeditions records

bioghist.p: The first Academy of Natural Sciences trip took most of the members to Perkiomen Copper Mines by horse and buggy, April 18, 1812. During the ensuing years Academy personnel has been part of thousands of treks into new collecting areas. Often the expeditions were privately financed or sent out by the Academy under grants from research foundations. Sometimes Academy scientists accompanied U.S. government expeditions. During recent years a committee of the council has acted to choose official names for special expeditions.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence, journals, and photographic records of various Academy expeditions. The materials include journals kept by Harold T. Green during the Angola/East Africa expedition in 1930 and the Vanderbilt African Expedition in 1934; photos documenting the mounting of a gorilla specimen evidently brought back from Vanderbilt African expedition; correspondence (mostly in the form of journal entries) describing the R.R.M. Carpenter expedition to Africa, 1936-1940; newspaper clippings on a 1940 expedition to Alaska to collect Dall's sheep; photographs from several expeditions, including those to Alaska, Ecuador, Mexico, Indochina, and the South Pacific, 1930s-1940s; photographs from the Stroud Guyana Shield , Venezuela. Expedition, 1985; and letters from Bob Peck containing field reports from the Lake Hovsgol, Mongolia expedition, 1994-1995.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. Exhibits Dept. records (Harold T. Green boxes contain materials on several expeditions), Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Managing Director records, Donald Ker papers, and A. L. Wolf papers.
